CatDescriptText: Mary M. Midia, paymaster and part-time model, Duquesne, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 23, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that there will be a steel strike?  Do you think steelworkers are entitled to the raise which they requested or do you think wages should be frozen, according to the argument of the steel industry management?" answer reads: "here [sic] is going to be a strike.  I don't think that a raise in pay is justified because such a raise will badly affect the whole economy."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Mary M. Midia wearing coat with fur collar, standing in front of the Brass Rail Restaurant, Smithfield Street, Downtown
